result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with elements and criminal case settlement

cases #13CF265, #14CF331, #14CF409 called at 8:57am. [MK]
Defendant Jasper L Gronert in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Cases #13CF265 and #14CF409 each, Mr. Gronert waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for trial. Arrignment is held:  Service of Informations admitted; readings waived.

In Case #14CF409, the Court amends Count #3 to Class A Misdemeanor Bailjumping contrary to Statute 946.49(1) (a) 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered in Case #13CF265 on Counts #3 and #5, and in Case #14CF409 on Count #3 ; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (DA Happ submits the victim impact statement in case #13CF265); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Gronert guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1, #2, #4 and #6 in Case #13CF265, the entirety of Case #14CF331, and Counts #1, #2, and #4 of Case 
#14CF409.

During the Sentencing portion of the hearing Attorney Zarwell submits documention regarding treatment Mr. Gronert has undergone; these documents are marked as Defendant's Exhibit #1. 


In Case #13CF265 on Counts #3 and #5, and in Case #14CF409 on Count #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Gronert on Probation for two years, with conditions:

--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with Carrie Gronert unless both Carrie Gronert and the Agent agree
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court appointed attorney fees 
--in Case #13CF265 on Count #3: to pay costs of $243, plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge, plus $200 DNA surcharge
--in Case #13CF265 on Count #5: to pay costs of $243, plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge, plus $200 DNA surcharge
--in Case #14CF331 to pay costs of $243,  plus $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  1  day on case #13CF265 and 1 day on case #14CF409.

As to Case #13CF265 only:    The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.

Contact prohibtion warnings/penalties given 
The Court finds that Mr. Gonert is not eligible for expungement of these cases. 
recess 9:22am
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2014 at 08:45 am.

cases #13CF265 and #14CF331 called at 9:25am. [MK]
Defendant Jasper L Gronert in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defense has documents completed for the entry of changes of plea today, however Attorney Zarwell requests that the plea/sentencing date be scheduled in 2-3 weeks to allow the Defense further time to prepare. 
The Court adjourns. 
Mr. Gronert indicates that he continues to reside at the Browning Avenue, Jefferson address.
recess 9:27am. 

NEXT:  schedule both cases for Plea/Sentencing on 12/22/14 at 8:45am

Judge Weston presiding for Branch III Intake: 
case called at 1:23pm. [Clerk: MK]
Defendant Jasper L Gronert appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD appears for bond purposes only; Mr. Gronert does not qualify for PD representation).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings are given;  Mr. 
Constitutional rights given
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $250  cash bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no direct or indirect contact with Carrie Gronert except in court for court-purposes
--no contact with his children except as authorized through the Family Court; the most current Family Court placement order is the 9/12/14 Order entitled "Support Order"
--no presence at the residence of Carrie Gronert: 730 W. Blackhawk Drive in the City of Fort Atkinson

Attorney Zarwell indicates that she has provided Mr. Gronert with the form to petition for court appointed counsel.
recess 1:39pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/15/14 at 11:20am  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing on 10/27/14 at 8:30am.
